topic.title: Alerts
topic.shortdesc: Provide contextual feedback messages for typical user actions with the handful of available and flexible alert messages.

section.title: Example
section.p: Alerts are available for any length of text, as well as an optional close button. For proper styling, use one of the eight required contextual classes (e.g., set outputclass to alert-success).

section.title: Additional content
section.p: Alerts can also contain additional HTML elements like headings, paragraphs, icons and links.

section.title: Well done!
section.p: Aww yeah, you successfully read this important alert message. This example text with a link is going to run a bit longer so that you can see how spacing within an alert works with this kind of content.
Whenever you need to, be sure to use margin utilities to keep things nice and tidy.

body.codeblock:
<i outputclass="bi bi-emoji-smile pe-2"/>Well done!

Aww yeah, you successfully read this important alert message. This example text with a link is going to run a bit longer so that you can see how spacing within an alert works with this kind of content.

Whenever you need to, be sure to use margin utilities to keep things nice and tidy.

section.title: Notes
section.p: DITA note elements are displayed as alerts according to the type attribute.

div.note: This note will speed you on your way.
Don't forget to do what this note says.
This is a fine little tip.
Please pay extra attention to this note.
You can't do what this note says.
This is something other than a normal note.

body.codeblock: <note type="note">This is just a note.</note> <note type="notice">Notice this piece of information.</note> <note type="fastpath">This note will speed you on your way.</note> <note type="remember">Don't forget to do what this note says.</note> <note type="tip">This is a fine little tip.</note> <note type="attention">Please pay extra attention to this note.</note> <note type="caution">Care is required when proceeding.</note> <note type="important">This note is important.</note> <note type="restriction">You can't do what this note says.</note> <note type="danger">You may hurt yourself!</note> <note type="other" othertype="Another note">This is something other than a normal note.</note>
body.p: The type can be overridden by using an outputclass.
body.codeblock: <note outputclass="alert-primary">This is a primary note.</note> <note outputclass="alert-secondary">This is a secondary note.</note> <note outputclass="alert-light">This is light note.</note> <note outputclass="alert-dark">This is dark note.</note>
